source: Care During Pregnancy and Childbirth Training Manual for CHO at AB-HWC
text:
high blood pressure is sufficient to categorise her as having 
pre-eclampsia.  Refer her to the PHC-MO immediately.
 ∙ If the diastolic blood pressure of the woman is above 110 mmHg, it is a danger sign that points towards 
imminent eclampsia. The urine albumin should be estimated at the earliest. If it is strongly positive, the woman 
should be referred to the FRU IMMEDIATELY.
 ∙ If the woman has high blood pressure but no urine albumin, she should be referred to the PHC Medical Officer.
 ∙ A w
